title: 109_s2202
content: Federal Judiciary Ethics Reform Act of 2006 - Amends the federal judicial code to: (1) establish within the Treasury a Judicial Education Fund for the payment of necessary expenses incurred by a judge or justice in attending a private judicial seminar approved by the Board of the Federal Judicial Center. And (2) require each justice, judge, and magistrate of the United States to maintain a list of all financial interests that would require disqualification in any proceeding in which his or her impartiality might reasonably be questioned. Directs the Judicial Conference of the United States to promulgate regulations to prohibit the solicitation or acceptance of anything in value in connection with a private judicial seminar, with specified exceptions.
